Package main

Class CalculatorAdvanced

java.lang.Object
main.Calculator
main.CalculatorAdvanced
public class CalculatorAdvanced extends Calculator
CalculatorAdvances class provides basic and advanced arithmetic operations and extends Calculator class.
Since:
11.02.2024.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Igor Grubisa

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • calculateAdvanced

      public void calculateAdvanced(char action) throws NotSupportedOperationException, NumberNotInAreaException
      This method finds power of the number and calculate factorial for the number within the range 0-10.
      Parameters:
      action - This parameter marks the operation it will be performed on the current value of calculator.
      Throws:
      NotSupportedOperationException - This type of exception will be thrown if user attempt to perform unsupported arithmetic operation.
      NumberNotInAreaException - This type of exception will be thrown if user passes the number that is not within range 0-10.

    • powerOfNumber

      private int powerOfNumber(int base, int exponent)
      Auxiliary method used for calculating power of the number.
      Parameters:
      base - This parameter is the current value of calculator.
      exponent - This parameter indicates how many times base number will be multiply by themselves.
      Returns:
      Return the result of exponentiation.

    • hasCharacteristic

      public Boolean hasCharacteristic(char value) throws NotSupportedOperationException, NumberNotInAreaException
      Second arithmetic method of CalculatorAdvances class that check if current value of calculator is Armstrong or perfect number.
      Parameters:
      value - This parameter indicates which characteristic of the number will be searched.
      Returns:
      Return true if the current value of calculator is Armstrong or perfect number.
      Throws:
      NotSupportedOperationException - This type of exception will be thrown if user passes anything else than 'A' or 'P'.
      NumberNotInAreaException - This type of exception will be thrown if the integer part of current value of calculator is smaller than 1.

    • isArmstrongNumber

      private boolean isArmstrongNumber(int number)
      Auxiliary method used for testing if the passed number is Armstrong.
      Parameters:
      number - This parameter is the number which will be tested.
      Returns:
      Return true if passed number is Armstrong, false otherwise.

    • isPerfectNumber

      private boolean isPerfectNumber(int number)
      Auxiliary method used for testing if the passed number is perfect number.
      Parameters:
      number - This parameter is the number which will be tested.
      Returns:
      Return true if passed number is perfect number, false otherwise.
